intro: Cyperus alpestris, commonly known as the alpine sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to temperate regions, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, and its flowering period occurs in the spring and early summer. Cyperus alpestris plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
